{"step_by_step_thinking": "Postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) is a common complication after surgery. The documents mention several factors that can contribute to PONV. Document [24] mentions that inhalational agents, including nitrous oxide (N2O), are associated with PONV. Document [23] mentions that opioids, which are often used during surgery, are strong emetogens, meaning they can induce vomiting. Document [22] suggests that ingested blood can be a cause of PONV. However, none of the documents mention acetaminophen as a cause of PONV.", "answer_choice": "D. Acetaminophen"}
